meta.name: description
meta.content: Jefferson School district comprises Jefferson High School, Jefferson Middle School, North Elementary School and Sodt Elementary School and is located in Newport, Michigan.

div.p: Update as of April 20, 2020: Food distribution is scheduled for Tuesday, April 21st only of this week. You will receive seven breakfast and lunches. Curbside pick up will be available from 10:30 a.m. - 12:00 p.m. Bus routes will run as normal.

img.alt: Beautiful Sky over the Middle School
Varsity Baseball at Mud Hens Field

div.br: Jefferson School District roughly parallels Lake Erie and Interstate 75 in Eastern Monroe County. We serve parts of the City of Monroe, Frenchtown Township and Berlin Township. About 1700 student attend Jefferson Schools. We have four buildings. H. F. Sodt Elementary School, near the south end of the district, houses preschool, kindergarten and first grade. Sodt is also the home to Cub Care, our daycare program, serving infants to four year old children. North Elementary School, on the northern end of the district, houses second, third and fourth grades. Jefferson Middle School, on our central campus, houses fifth, sixth, seventh, and eighth grades. Jefferson High School, also on the central campus, has ninth, tenth, eleventh, and twelfth grade students attending. Also on central campus, is our Recreation Center, which has athletic and recreation facilities for students and community alike. Please contact us if you would like a tour of any of our facilities.

div.p: This website is currently being redesigned to comply with both Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act and Title II of the Americans with Disabilities Act. If you see anything on this site that does not comply with either Act please notify us immediately so we can correct the problem. Email kstrazzulla@jeffersonschools.org or call 734-289-5550.
